subject: Art & Design
title: Documentary Photography: Truth in Frames
description: A 60-second lesson on Documentary Photography: Truth in Frames.

hook.text: Dorothea Lange's 'Migrant Mother' showed America what the Great Depression looked like. Policy changed.

buildup.text: Documentary photography records real events as they happen, without staging or manipulation.

discovery.text: Its power lies in credibility. Viewers trust that what they see actually happened.

twist.text: Digital manipulation blurs the line. News agencies now require unedited RAW files to verify authenticity.

climax.text: From war zones to climate change, documentary photos create empathy that statistics never can.

punchline.text: One authentic photo can do what a thousand words can't.

quiz.question: Why do news agencies require unedited RAW files from photographers?
options: To verify the photo hasn't been digitally manipulated
RAW files are smaller in size
